DOCNAME: CASE OF NEBUSOVA v. HUNGARY AND SLOVAKIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She has a son whose father , a NORP national , lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Bratislava CARDINALth ORG ( GPE ) ordered the father to pay child maintenance .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , on behalf of her son , filed a petition with ORG for the judicial enforcement of the maintenance payments . She claimed that , since DATE , the father had not been paying the maintenance regularly or in full .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG increased the amount of child maintenance payable by the father retroactively , as from DATE . The judgment became final and binding on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG forwarded the applicant ’s petition for enforcement to ORG ( GPE ) under a DATE treaty between former GPE and GPE . On DATE enforcement proceedings were instituted before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having heard the debtor and obtained documents from his employer and the bank handling the transfer of child maintenance payments in foreign currency , informed GPE directly of its finding that the debtor had been making regular payments . Since no reply or acknowledgement was received from the NORP authorities , ORG attempted service through ORG Service was finally acknowledged on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant had answered the debtor ’s objection lodged in the meantime . She requested ORG to re - examine the amount and regularity of the payments . On DATE the court received information from the bank that some payments had been withheld on account of the applicant ’s failure to submit a certificate of school attendance , which was required once her son had reached the age of DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE or DATE ORG observed that the applicant ’s petition for enforcement concerned amounts due for DATE . It informed her that a claim for maintenance concerning any periods preceding the claim by DATE could only be enforced if she proved that the father had acted in bad faith or that she had had serious and justified reasons for not having petitioned for enforcement earlier . The court invited the applicant to substantiate within DATE of service of the decision whether either of these conditions was met . The decision was served on the applicant through ORG on DATE . On DATE she replied via ORG ( GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s petition for enforcement finding that , despite its above instruction , the applicant had failed to provide the relevant information . The decision was served through ORG . On the applicant ’s appeal in DATE , the GPE - Abaúj - Zemplén County Regional Court ( GPE ) quashed the first - instance order and remitted the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , on DATE ORG declared the decisions of GPE executable . This decision became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE execution proceedings were instituted against the father . It appears that on CARDINAL DATE and DATE , respectively , the judicial executor attempted to attach the father ’s salary and tangible assets .

CARDINAL . On DATE the father filed with ORG an objection to the execution . After the applicant ’s claims had been recalculated ( given that the debt was determined in NORP currency , whereas the applicant had claimed payments in NORP dollars , and the amounts were deducted from the debtor ’s salary in NORP currency ) , the execution order was supplemented on DATE and served on DATE .
